review.title: Clean and convenient, but...
review.reviewText: It happened to be a warm night during my stay.  After cooling down the room, I turned off the air conditioner in my room.  However, the occupant of the adlacent room, left the air conditioner in that room on all night.  It was so noisy, I couldn't sleep.  I requested a wake up call, and my request was acknowledged.  The wake up call never came.  Fortuitously, I was awake all night, so I didn't need a wake up call to get me to my early morning meeting.
review.negativeRemarks: If they tell you they will provide a wake up call, the call should be provided.

review.title: Parking tight due to repaving a portion
review.reviewText: Easy access from highway.  Staff very accommodating. . .tasteful room decor with plenty of space.  Nearby shopping.  Lovely setting.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access and friendly staff

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: very nice highly recommended and satisfied and happy and very nice and very happy ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
review.positiveRemarks: everything
review.negativeRemarks: na
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.reviewText: Very nice in every way. Nice rooms. Comfortable bed.

review.title: Pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: Not usually a Courtyard guy, but this was very convenient for business travel and within walking distance of some good restaurants without being loud.

review.title: On the Bay in Larkspur
review.reviewText: Great location, north of San Francisco. A real perk is the ferry from Larkspur to San Francisco and its across the street from the hotel. There is also a sweet market center of restaurants and stores, next to the hotel too. The facility is modern, clean, with a Bistro, swimming pool, gym and terrific staff. I have stayed here several times, and will go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Explore the northern coast and San Francisco.

review.title: a great sray
review.reviewText: Nice hotel , clean well appointed in quiet but convenient location with shops and dining nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful. A bit pricey but we were quite satisfied with the experience

review.title: Room
review.reviewText: I booked a King and received a Queen handicapped room. I paid a lot of money for my room and was very disapointed!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: North Bay Get away!
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in a quiet beautiful setting with easy access to more than you can imagine. Shopping, dinning, salons, a Barber, Movies, history, Ferry, Wine, scenic roads, national parks, colleges, and the coast. We did it all including a Professional Ball Game.  Oh, and the variety of whether is unimaginable. The beauty of rolling fog, sails being filled with wind, sunshine shores popping up, and even House Boats! Loved it!
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel has easy access to parking, food, elevator, and the pool. It is clean, has a friendly staff, great beds, balconies, and location.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks:
Scenic Roads, National Parks, the Bay, the Ocean, the country, wineries, quaint towns, sports, dinning, shopping, History, 
bicycling, and picnicing.

review.title: Pricey but worth it!
review.reviewText: The staff in the Starbucks in the lobby were Awesome!
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy, Clean, Convienient
review.negativeRemarks: Not very kid friendly, we had 12 Girl Scouts and guests were complaining at 9pm that they were too noisy??
review.locationRemarks: Awesome Location!!!

review.title: Nice hotel,  excellent location
review.reviewText: No problems,  clean, comfortable  options,  individual seating arrangements
review.positiveRemarks: Atmosphere
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing much
review.locationRemarks: Ferry larkspur landing

review.title: Excellent place to explore SF
review.reviewText: We were right across the street from the ferry terminal that took us to the piers.  Location was perfect!  Room was clean and large.  Nice staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, modern, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Na
review.locationRemarks: Ferry, marketplace

review.reviewText: Cleanliness was well below expectations.  Staff was terrific

review.title: Comfortable hotel near SF
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised how close this hotel was to San Francisco. The price was reasonable and the beds comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good and large comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Add some character and color to the place. It's kind of drab.
review.locationRemarks: Marin Headlands on a sunny day. Mt Tamilpais. All of San Francisco is close by too.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: A perfect spot between SF and the wine country. Quiet and with good restaurants and the bay across the road.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, easy in and out.

review.title: Not a destination hotel, but good stopover.
review.reviewText: If you are travelling north of San Francisco and want an overnight spot outside of the city, this is fine.

review.title: Overpriced.
review.reviewText: A decent hotel convenient to the Larkspur-San Francisco ferry, but profoundly overpriced for the location and quality of the facility.  We made the decision to stay in Larkspur and take the ferry to avoid the outrageous hotels and parking fees in SF proper; however, next time, we will likely stay in SF, pay the additional fees, and (hopefully) have an experience that reflects the money spent.  (The ferry ride was nice but >$40 for two people round trip, so not much cheaper than hotel parking in SF.)

review.title: Nice eating, shopping nearby good location
review.reviewText: Near fwy.  No wastebasket in shower/toilet room.  Very convenient for ferry to SF.

It was amazing how accommodating the staff was when my husband and I arrived with our twin grandsons, aged one. I asked the lady at the front desk where I could buy some milk and she walked over to the bistro and gave me some on the house! It continued to be a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to San Francisco, without the high ticket price.
review.negativeRemarks: More parking, but that would be difficult with the layout.
review.locationRemarks: Beautiful Marin County! Close to shopping areas, and not far from many Northern California tourist spots.

review.title: Staying on the Bay, North of the City.
review.reviewText: We wanted to go into the City - San Francisco for the 4th of July, but didn't want to drive in or deal with all the other people visiting for the holiday. So we decided to stay in Larkspur and take the ferry over the bay. We found the Courtyard Larkspur. The location was tucked away in the hills on the bay, across the street from where the ferry terminal is located. The Courtyard was very nice with clean comfortable rooms, pool and onsite bistro type restaurant. We had a wonderful time.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: We couldn't find the elevators. There needs to be signs to find the elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Of course going to San Francisco. Novato, and Sausalito. Beautiful area. Lots of shopping and dining.

review.reviewText:
Clean, comfortable and quiet. Best place in town
We always stay here
review.locationRemarks: Point Reyes, downtown san francisco

review.reviewText: Everything you'd expect in a perfect, convenient, bright hotel experience. Give them a visit and enjoy!!!
Good, I got what I was looking for... an easy trip into SF to work, a return trip where I eat then work and sleep...
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet... good air quality in the location, easy access to SF
review.negativeRemarks: remove the heavy rubber smelling shower curtains with something that may be washable and and easy enough to clean...

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Nice place, good location.  Have stayed here many times, and will again

review.title: Fantastically convenient to the Larkspur ferry
review.reviewText: easy access to nearby Starbucks, convenient location to the Marin Airporter station, 5 minute walk to Marin Brewery, AND 7 minute walk to the Larkspur ferry.   Lots of choices for transportation from SFO, take advantage of lower hotel rates in Marin, but an easy ferry ride to work in the city.   I'll be back!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, great flexible staff, decent on-site amenities
review.negativeRemarks: need some more gym stuff...just a few weights, treadmills and cycles
review.locationRemarks: ferry, Marin Airporter, Starbucks, Marin Brewpub...all easy walks

review.title: Perfect For The Bay Area Vacation!
review.reviewText: We always stay at Larkspur Landing because of the convenience. It's like a mini resort. Weather is good for a dip in the pool, which you can't do in San Francisco!Easy freeway access to San Francisco, the coast, wine country.Across the street is Larkspur Landing shops and restaurants and the Ferry to San Francisco! Take in a baseball game the easy way!
review.positiveRemarks: It's our home away from home and the staff even remembers us from previous stays.
review.negativeRemarks: More opportunities for complimentary coffee other than The Bistro.
review.locationRemarks: Larkspur Landing. The Country Mart across the street. Shopping close by. The Ferry to San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Took my grand daughter for a weekend away.  We loved staying there because it was walking distance to the ferry, the Larkspur Landing shops and restaurants, and close to freeways to make our stay so much better and less hectic.
review.positiveRemarks: Very convenient to Ferry, shops, freeways and all.
review.negativeRemarks: Price is a bit high for that location.

review.reviewText: It was nice and comfortable, close to Matyn, 25 min-you are in SF, and 101-who is trevelling both ways-North and South-

review.title: Great Location....Pleasant surroundings
review.reviewText: The Courtyard at Larkspur Landing is a very pleasant place to stay.  It's convenient with access to good restaurants, the ferry to San Francisco, and great shopping.  We enjoyed our stay.  The room is small but had all we needed.  The lobby is very welcoming with good access to food and drink.

review.title: Easy access to everything
review.reviewText: Great location. It's across the street from the new Larkspur Country Mart. Parking is easy and free. The rooms are clean and nice. Check in/out was a breeze. I'd definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, easy parking, comfortable bed, variety of pillows, good TV channel options (they even had a movie channel), nice staff
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from the new Country Mart which has amazing stores and restaurants.

managementResponses.response: We thank you for the sincere comments from your stay here in Larkspur. Our brand is doing its very best to offer the ammenties to make your stay comfortable. We hope to see you again and have a great beginning to your year.

review.title: Simple but fine.
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, well-located. If you want full restaurant or bar, you'll probably be disappointed. All I needed were a drink at night and juice and coffee at breakfast. My room was quiet, everything was convenient, the price fair. All in all, a good choice for a short stay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you so much for the loevely comments. We most certainly will try to improve on the housekeeping program. We are very grateful you came to join us and we hope to see you in the future. Have a wonderful beginning to 2015.

review.title: Golden Gate Closed Today
review.reviewText: Easy check in, friendly staff, could not chsnge anything due to using 3fd party Expedia. Wanted 2 Queens instead of king and sofa bed. Wanted to leave gratuity on credit card on file. They ate not set up for this. Told me leave it in cash in the room.great new benefit for housekeepers if you could leave something on card at check out.
Great location!  I resent being asked to supply more verbiage in order to submit this review

review.title: Nice hotel. Convenient to shopping and ferry.
review.reviewText: Enjoyable stay, nice and quite, and the breakfast was pleasant.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback from your stay here in Larkspur. We are very sorry that your arrival experience was not welcoming, and we are going to review this experience for the future and make certain we have our team ready and prepared to make your arrival perfect. We do hope to see you again in the future and thank you for choosing our hotel.

review.reviewText: Upon arrving no one greeted me, when I steped up to the registration area the worker never smiled or welcomed me. She wasn't very informative. The room was great and very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleaniness
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service
review.locationRemarks:
Muir Woods
Sausalito 
Muir Beach

managementResponses.response: Thank you fo much for the fantastic review. We will continue to strive for 5 star service.

review.reviewText: Great hotel and staff. Service is excellent. Wish there had been a safe in the room. Other than that, had an excellent stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A pleasant hotel. A couple of things needed attention but when reported to the Front desk were fixed immediately. The Small restaurant was very good for breakfast and the Market convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and facilities
review.locationRemarks: The Larkspur Landing was so convenient to catch the ferry to San Francisco and there were great restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
A very pleasant experience. I was up at 5:30 AM to see a relative off who was catching an early flight.

Fresh Starbucks coffee was available in the lobby!

One negative was that hot water was not available for a morning shower.
review.positiveRemarks:
Nice location. Nice surroundings. Large parking lot. 

Easy access from and to Hwy 101 in Marin.

Pleasant staff.
review.locationRemarks: Peacock Gap golf course is close to the hotel

review.title: Comfy and quietly hotel
review.reviewText:
Just stop for a night, checking was a breeze,2 minutes the most and we where on the way to room which it was really clean all over!
Staff so courteous. Crossing street was a brewery with oven brick pizza, just delicious, I definitely would stayed again here!
Pleasant place, a fairly standard Courtyard, a short walk to interesting shops at Larkspur Landing

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean room, comfy beds. Great location close to muir woods & a short ferry ride into the city.

review.title: Wonderful experience!  Beautiful setting!
review.reviewText:
Right across the street from the award winning Marin Brewing Co.
Food & Brew were awesome!

review.title: Great hotel, Safe, handy location.
review.reviewText: Loved this place, Staff were helpful and friendly, free parking, Clean, in a safe area, with a good choice of great food & drink outlets on your doorstep or in the hotel. Also the ferry terminal was only 5 mins away ( cost about $22 dollars per adult return into the city.) Also from the same terminal you can prebook a ferry which takes you to & from the AT&T stadium to watch the SF Giants games, very handy. overall if you want a hotel 40 mins by ferry out of the city, this is perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, to local facilities in a peaceful area.

review.reviewText: Lots to do right around the hotel, not a bad drive into SF.  Easy drive to attractions north (Muir Woods, etc.).  $7 toll each trip on the Golden Gate Bridge into SF.  Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Convenient location great neighborhood
review.reviewText: Conveniently located across from great shopping and restaurants. Comfortable surroundings neighborhood feel. Walking access to the SF ferry, movie, SF Airporter, shopping, restaurants, ect. Overall great experience!

review.title: Nice place, close to city.
review.reviewText: We wanted to say at a hotel that wasn't right in the city of SF but close enough to get around the Bay Area easily.  this hotel provided that, along with a nice, large room, free wifi, pool, spa, and gym.   the area was quiet with easy access to freeway. Bed was comfy too. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice desk staff and easy access to freeway yet quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing.
review.locationRemarks: close to restaurants, shopping, and plenty of things to do outside and in.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: Location was great perfect jumping off point to ferry,Sausalito, my ur woods, Stinson beach,point Reyes lighthouse. The restaurant in the hotel was awsome. A nice surprise! Pool was clean and grounds were too. Right across the street is a nice shopping area with restaurants Marin brewing company has great food and beer. Front desk staff helpful and accommodating Will def stay here again!

managementResponses.response: The hotel brand has set up a new design for Breakfast and Dinner, and the quality of food is fantastic. Thank you for the response.

review.title: Excellent facilities and in a great location.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the approach to dinnner and breakfast. The bistro was first class and offered a pleasant change to the traditional hotel breakfast. Located next to the ferry port made getting in and out of San Francisco very easy.

managementResponses.response: We're excited you had a great time with us and we thank you for the kind comments. We'll look forward to seeing you again.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable and close to our activities. We will stay there again.

review.title: Close to the ferry and a shopping center.
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before and love the location. It is walking distance to eateries, shopping, a morning latte. A great place to just relax.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff really wants to accommodate you.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe have the heat turned down a little. A little to warm in the room for our sleeping comfort.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect place to catch the ferry and enjoy the day in the city, Close to Sausalito, downtown Larkspur, and safe environment for getting a walk in.

managementResponses.response: We look forward to your next stay with us, and we thank you for the feedback. We love to hear when our guests have a wonderfultime. Enjoy the Spring Season .

review.title: Quiet and clean
review.reviewText: My husband and I found our 5-day stay there pleasant all the way around. We love it and will stay here again if we are back in the area!
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet and clean; staff members are friendly and courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of coffee in the room can be better
review.locationRemarks: Take the ferry into the city without messing with the traffice. The Marin Brewery is near by with good food.

review.title: Very nice staff, adequate facility
review.reviewText: The helpful, generous staff people always made an effort to offer suggestions and provide assistance. Unfortunately, things like the glasses in our room (and on the maid's cart) not having been cleaned properly by the dishwasher the day of our check-in, and a very dirty blanket being inside the supposedly "clean" blanket bag were the kinds of things the staff had to help with. It's a decent location, and I loved that the room had a nice balcony where you could actually open the sliding doors and get fresh air!
review.positiveRemarks: Really good staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Some attention to detail before the customer notices and needs replacements, and a food and coffee area open all day would be better.
review.locationRemarks: Good access to dining and shopping nearby.

review.title: Courtyard Larkspur Landing
review.reviewText: It was good. The front desk staff explained all the amenities. Checkout was easy.

review.title: Great location for a getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect! Clean, modern, comfortable, and quiet. We didn't hear people in rooms near us or above us. Our favorite part was the location: just a quick stroll to a delicious breakfast spot across the street (the Rustic Bakery) and Starbucks. Another short walk to the movie theater. Close to the water. Easy drive to the Golden Gate Bridge. It felt out of the way, relaxing, beautiful, and close enough to activities to balance out a perfect getaway.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: Starbucks and Marin brewing Co. Close by. Do people really still take towels from hotels. These towels were so ruff it almost hurt to dry yourself. This isn't the only hotel with this problem. Over the last few years it seems to be getting worse. Do we have to start bringing our own towels? That was my only complaint and not a big deal.

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable and close to the ferry, Muir woods, and great dining

review.title: Clean, comfortable, and convenient
review.reviewText: We came from out of state, needing to be close to the Marin County Civic Center and wanting to be near the ferry to San Francisco. This hotel met all of our needs, and I am a stickler for hotel cleanliness. The beds were very comfortable, the linens and bathroom very clean. It was very convenient to walk across the street to the restaurants and the ferry terminal, and we felt safe returning after dark. Breakfast wasn't included, which appears to be par for the area, but the food in the restaurant was very good. Starbucks coffee was complimentary during the morning hours.
review.positiveRemarks: I most appreciated the cleanliness and the modern feel.
review.locationRemarks: There are shops and restaurants right across the street, and the ferry terminal is within easy walking distance. It is also very near San Rafael.

review.title: Convenient Marin hotel
review.reviewText: Very close to San Francisco, great Marin Mart shopping / dining / relaxing center next door, nice grounds, building, rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located to ferry, SF
review.reviewText: Upon check in Jackie assisted and went above and beyond to assure we got a nice room. Everyone was very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed/pillows, clean, great location for us.
review.negativeRemarks: thicker towels
review.locationRemarks: ferry across street to SF, wine country about 45 minutes, hiking in Marin county

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here a couple of days as a base for my HS reunion and was pleasantly surprised.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice big, comfortable rooms. Well maintained.
review.locationRemarks: Its just across the street from nice "mall" with boutique shops and nice eating places

review.title: Better Than Expected
review.reviewText: I had never stayed at a Marriott Courtyard before (we usually travel with our cats so seek out pet-friendly venues) so I didn't know what to expect. The hotel was well-located, very central to all of Marin. The room was nice, the bed comfortable and the pool was great - lots of sun with water just the right temperature. The pool chairs, however, were quite uncomfortable. Loved the convenience of the computers in the lobby for the use of guests and the Boarding Pass computer and printer too. I was disappointed that there was not a full-service restaurant on the premises and the staff, while very pleasant and welcoming, did not offer much in the way of recommendations when we wanted a place for brunch. The gym was adequate. My only other complaints would be that the bathroom towels were a bit thin and hard and the number of TV stations rather limited. Overall, though, I would recommend this property and would return if I were in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool, computers in the lobby, location
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of the towels, comfort of the pool chairs, available TV stations, restaurant
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right across the street from the Marin Country Mart and the ferry to SF and a short ride to Sausalito.

review.title: Convenient location, up-to-date facilities
review.reviewText: We stayed here as a launch point for different places in Marin County.
review.positiveRemarks: The facilities were clean and up-to-date. Very happy with our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much to be improved. The breakfast cafe could have healthier options.
review.locationRemarks: It's right on the freeway, so it was convenient to get around. We went to Mt. Tamalpais and Muir woods-not extremely close, but just straight down 101

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were great and the room on the 1st level was perfect. It was nice to unwind by the outdoor fireplace or on our patio.
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy and close to San Francisco

review.title: Quiet hotel
review.reviewText: Quiet room and friendly staff. Close to the city within a freeway drive away. Cute shops and restaurants nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean quiet

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location for getting to ferry for trip into San Francisco. Lovely courtyard and pool area. Would definitely stay here again. Check-in/check-out staff did not appear to be organized.

review.title: Good value for money and convenient location
review.reviewText: Nestled in a quiet corner, the hotel is located opposite Larkspur Landing Ferry station, which makes getting into the city as easy as can be. No battling through traffic! The Marin AirPorter Bus drops you an easy five minutes walk from the hotel, so no need for a taxi or rental car to get to and from SFO airport. If you are a bike rider, across the road is a bike shop where you can rent a bike and ride around Marin's famously bike friendly roads and the many fabulous trails. The hotel itself is excellent value: around $200 for a double room with extremely comfortable queen bed, free wifi, a large flat screen TV, couch and desk. Fitness center, nice pool and respectable food available at the restaurant - although there are dozens of good restaurants in the area. A short distance to top quality Molly Stones Food Market if you don't want to eat out. The staff is efficient and friendly. Print out your boarding pass at the bank of lobby computers. Who needs the luxury of $400-500 a night hotels in the city? Oh, and there's a movie theater just down the road too.
review.positiveRemarks: See above, but especially that it was DEAD QUIET at night.
review.negativeRemarks: No

review.title: The staff is fabulous!
review.reviewText: I left my coat in my room and it had my cameras in it. Maria found it and made sure I got it back. What a wonderful staff!

review.title: Great base near to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed here as a base close to San Francisco but not to be in the middle of the city. It was a perfect location. The hotel is being renovated so there is a little disruption. However, the newly renovated rooms (we stayed in one) are very nice. Good size, well appointed and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size and cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic!

review.title: Clean, comfortable and well maintained.
review.reviewText: Hotel is currently under construction, they are 75% complete. Some touch ups required. Elevators are in the centre of each wing and easily accessible, handicap access from both parking lots to the lobby. Some food available at the Starbucks Bistro, no dinner items. The king size beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms are quite large and well lit. Unfortunately, the towels are thin and coarse but serve the purpose. Individual cup coffeemaker is provided with only one regular and one decaf. Difficult to have two cups of the same coffee. Nice large screen tv with limited programs unless you like sports. Views of the courtyard makes it a little more private.
review.positiveRemarks: King-size bed with 6 comfortable pillows
review.negativeRemarks: Food choices in lobby Bistro
review.locationRemarks: Across the road from Golden Gate Ferry terminal and Marin Brewing Company

review.title: Great Location to the ferry.
review.reviewText: I didn't like the fact that the computer locked us out of our room on the day we were to check out. We had a late breakfast, came back to find our key would not open our room. The maid across the aisle would not let us in with a master key. I went to the front desk and she said to tell the maid it was OK to let us in. She refused to open the door and I had to make an extra trip back to the front desk to have another key made to open the door.
review.positiveRemarks: The food area, the little store to buy items and the bar.
review.negativeRemarks: The maid that would not let us in our room even after a manager OK'd it. Poor guest relations.
review.locationRemarks: Well kept and pleasing drive up. Nice curb appeal and close to the ferry into the city.

review.title: This hotel can be more generous.
review.reviewText:
You would think for the price this hotel could put two bags of coffee in the room. The coffee is by the cup and when two people are in the room, there should be two cups of coffee.... even though the coffee is less than stellar.
We stay in it because it is so close to the Ferry and we can get in and out of the city so easily. And, parking is free for a week or so, when we travel. These are great perks!
review.positiveRemarks: close to the ferry! Plus free overnight parking if traveling
review.negativeRemarks: lack of good coffee!!

review.title: Nice rooms, a bit pricey
review.reviewText: You can always count on the Courtyard at Larkspur Landing, but it is a pricey room. Well located, nice rooms, easy. Just too expensive (and we had a small discount), but that is Marin.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and ease of parking
review.negativeRemarks: price, and the alarm was set for 6 am
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco and near everything in the heart of Marin.

review.title: Just what we were looking for!
review.reviewText: Great location, helpful staff and good size room with a small balcony. It was quiet and perfect for our needs. Being so close to the ferry was a bonus as was the wonderful Farmers Market at the weekend. We will take back very good memories. Thank you!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Pretty good value.
review.reviewText: Somewhat of a time warp - lobby and rooms feel like they're out of the 70's. The bath in the double queen room was TINY and very crowded, and the room layout was very strange, but overall the facility is clean and relatively comfortable. Good location for access to Marin County (and to SF via ferries).
review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath and room layouts. Small self-service laundry only open 9am - 9pm. Made it hard to wash clothes when we returned from a day of sightseeing.

review.title: Thank you!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay.......... staff was very nice and helpful. FYI - The only thing I can say negitive is that our room had a smell like someone smoked and it had spray to cover the smell. If it had been worse I would have asked for a new room, but I was too tired to deal with it. Thank you! Jonell
review.positiveRemarks: the food bar

review.title: stay in marin
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, but just a couple of things to make it better. They should have ice makers and vending on each floor and microwaves in the rooms. For the price, I shouldn't have to go down 2 flights to get ice and since there is a refridgerator in the rooms, a microwave to warm things up would be nice. Most hotels now provide this service and since this was one of the more expensive hotels I've stayed in, I was disappointed the higher priced hotel didn't have this. Staff was very friendly and helpful, food was great in the bistro and the pool was very nice too. Overall satisfied.

review.title: Excellent in all categories except food & beverage
review.reviewText: Comfort, cleanliness , and amenities are excellent. Price for value is good. Would like to see Courtyard pay more attention to food and beverage with more flexible Serving hours and more reasonable prices. Courtyard good was write good, but their prices make airport prices look like a good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean.Comfortable. PC compatible. Print Boarding passes in lobby. Great locations. Light food fare.
review.negativeRemarks: No local shuttle. Limited good and beverage w inflexible hours.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. Close to shopping, Bay Ferry, and Airport transportation.

review.title: Meh?
review.reviewText: For the amount I paid I was a little let down although this is an expensive area. However, my room smelled of smoke and absolutely no vending machines? Guy at front desk offered information on places to eat and the area right across the way was suggested.....it was just OK. From his description I was expecting something nicer. Next time I'm in the area I'll try something else for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing really stood out.
review.negativeRemarks: Smokey smelling room. No vending machines for a late night soda.
review.locationRemarks: OK local with good dining in the general vicinity.

review.title: EVERYTHING I NEEDED FOR A REASONABLE PRICE
review.reviewText: Great location for meeting I had in San Rafale but convenient to Sausalito for great dining and shoping and close to many other points of interest. Clean and safe for a woman traveling alone.

review.title: Definately going back
review.reviewText: We will definately return for future stay. Friendly service, beautiful grounds, clean rooms, quiet atmosphere with a very convenient location.

review.title: Truly Excellent Service
review.reviewText: LOVED this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially when I asked for recommendations for dinner. They gave me a list of restaurants and maps to the ones I was interested in, and the gentlemen was actually knowledgeable about the restaurants and helped me decide based on what I told him I liked. The little bistro/cafe area next to the lobby was perfect for breakfast and had a great balance between hearty food and health-concious options, plus you can't beat a starbucks in the hotel so you don't have to drive to one! I would definitely stay again for business or if I'm ever in the area for leisure.

review.title: Not fancy, but perfectly fine
review.reviewText: My wife and I had to be in the area for one night. The room itself was quite nice in terms of comfort, cleanliness, general functionality. The internet service (free) was quite slow, which was a definite negative for me. The food service area is clean and functional, but you definitely want to go elsewhere if you want anything approaching a decent restaurant dinner. Fortunately, there are plenty of places in all price ranges within a 5 mile radius. The free coffee in the morning was first class and got us off to a good early start.

review.title: Great Room, Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We needed a hotel close to the Larkspur Ferry into San Francisco. The Marriott fit the bill. Walking distance to the ferry, clean spacious room, and an extremely friendly staff. Could not ask for anything more.

review.title: Fine but not outstandng
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location if you want to take the ferry to San Francisco. But there isn't much close by--a few uninteresting restaurants but little else. My room was spacious and pretty comfortable, though the bed could be better. One problem: the heating/air conditioning units are very noisy--so I had to get extra blankets at night so I could just turn the heat completely off. Not sure I will return.

review.title: Clean, great service and location
review.reviewText: Ferry, sushi, brew pub, and other great little shops and restaurants close by (walkable), plus in-house coffee and breakfast - what's not to like?

review.title: Larkspur
review.reviewText: Great

review.title: Stay in Larkspur and ferry to game!
review.reviewText: We love staying here! We walk to the ferry and go over to SF and go to the game. We then take Giants ferry back with all the lights of San Francisco twinkling around us! Beautiful!

review.title: We'll be back
review.reviewText:
Great spot to stay when you come to see a Giants' game - within walking distance of the Larkspur ferry and some very good restaurants. The hotel itself has an excellent and friendly staff, the courtyard is well designed for social gatherings and the room we stayed in was clean, comfortable and well furnished. Get a room with a balcony during the dry season and enjoy the fresh air. The only things that keep this from being a true four star hotel are: 1) not much of a view
2) lack of an onsite restaurant for dinner (it's more of a cafe) and
3) the predictable cheap coffeemaker in the room that never has enough packets for more than one person.
I actually booked this hotel by accident and I am so glad I did. We drive to the Bay Area once or twice a year to see a ball game and this is the perfect place from which to launch our adventures.

review.title: Clean, convenient, reasonably-priced
review.reviewText: Not a luxury hotel, but it's got everything you need at a fair price. Super clean, appointed with fridge and coffee maker, close to the Larkspur Ferry and plenty of decent restaurants, freeway-easy.

review.title: Good visit
review.reviewText: We literally were in town for about 10 hrs. so didn't 'use' the hotel much. But, it was in a nice area with a shopping center across the street with a gym, various casual restaurants and stores. Would stay there again.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: Our stay was very pleasant; The accomodations were superb. The room and the common areas were very clean. What a great concept when it comes to accomodations; we really liked the included full service breakfast buffet. If you are not looking for the glitz and are interested in getting in and getting out to your activities, this is the right place to be.

review.title: Nice quiet place!
review.reviewText: Loved how close it was to the Ferry. We went to the Giants game from there.

review.title: Great room, but $10+ for continental breakfast?!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the location of this hotel being within walking distance of the Larkspur Ferry and a couple of good restaurants for lunch and dinner; however, there was nothing close by for breakfast except a Starbucks so the hotel had a captive audience for breakfast and their prices were outrageous. As much as was spent on the room itself, surely the hotel should have at least "complimentary" fruit and danishes.

review.title: most definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Hotel very clean. Service was great. From the front desk to the breakfast buffet service. Everyone very polite.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Location is very near to the Ferry, but a bit far from the city by car. There are not much around the Location.

review.title: Clean and comfortable, convenient location
review.reviewText: Exactly what you'd expect from a Marriott Courtyard. The rooms are quiet and clean. You can walk to several restaurants and shops. We will definitely stay there again while visiting the Marin headlands and Point Reyes National Seashore.

review.title: Predictable
review.reviewText: Predictable for a business traveler is a good thing.  The only problem I had is the water wasn't very hot.  I complained to the front desk and it was taken care of promptly
